name: Scene-stealing giants
description: We Live in an Ocean of Air takes viewers inside the cycle of life through a giant sequoia (commonly known as a giant redwood). Find out how their ancient awesomeness has seen them loom over screen culture.

key_work.title: We Live in an Ocean of Air
key_work.credit_line:
Marshmallow Laser Feast

In collaboration with Natan Sinigaglia & James Bulley
key_work.brief_description:
We Live in an Ocean of Air is a multi-sensory immersive installation that illuminates the invisible- but fundamental- connection that ties animal and plant, human and natural world, into a wondrous rhythm which underpins life on Earth.

Existing in the liminal space between art, science and technology, it blurs the boundaries of installation, live performance and virtual reality and enchants the everyday world by revealing the natural forces that exist around us. Vitally, it provides an alternative platform to view the challenges our planet faces in the twenty-first century and helps us to reflect on our dependence and responsibility to the organisms we share it with.

From the food we eat, the water we drink and the air we breathe, humanity’s dependence on the natural world is absolute. The protection and regeneration of ecosystems is fundamental to our collective futures. Marshmallow Laser Feast confront these issues head on through a magical and moving experience - and invite you to join them on it.

constellations_primary.name: Scene-stealing giants
constellations_primary.description: We Live in an Ocean of Air takes viewers inside the cycle of life through a giant sequoia (commonly known as a giant redwood). Find out how their ancient awesomeness has seen them loom over screen culture.

start.title: Return of the Jedi
start.creator_credit: Richard Marquand, Howard Kazanjian and Lucasfilm, Ltd.
start.brief_description: The conclusion of the “Star Wars” trilogy begins with the rescue of Hans Solo from the evil clutches of Jabba the Hutt. The Galactic Empire has resurrected the Death Star and plans to eliminate the Rebel Alliance once and for all. Luke Skywalker, grappling with the secret that Darth Vader is his father, who was turned evil by the Dark Side of the Force, must confront the Emperor in one final battle. From the seedy den of Jabba the Hutt, to the luscious green peacefulness of the planet Endor with its Ewoks, “The Return of the Jedi” is an entralling action-packed special effects adventure.

constellations_other.name: Scene-stealing giants
constellations_other.description: We Live in an Ocean of Air takes viewers inside the cycle of life through a giant sequoia (commonly known as a giant redwood). Find out how their ancient awesomeness has seen them loom over screen culture.

end.title: The Lost World: Jurassic Park
end.creator_credit: Steven Spielberg, Michael Kahn, Colin Wilson, Gerald R. Molen, Amblin Entertainment, Digital Image Associates, Universal Pictures, Rick Carter and David Koepp
end.brief_description: Four years after Jurassic Park’s genetically bred dinosaurs ran amok, multimillionaire John Hammond shocks chaos theorist Ian Malcolm by revealing that he has been breeding more beasties at a secret location.

constellations_other.name: Scene-stealing giants
constellations_other.description: We Live in an Ocean of Air takes viewers inside the cycle of life through a giant sequoia (commonly known as a giant redwood). Find out how their ancient awesomeness has seen them loom over screen culture.

links.description: Ewoks aren’t the only fantastical creatures living among redwoods on-screen. Because of their age and size, they’ve been used to reflect prehistory, such as when a tyrannosaurus rex stomps through them in The Lost World.

end.title: Horizon Forbidden West
end.brief_description: Horizon Forbidden West continues Aloy’s story as she moves west to a far-future America to brave a majestic, but dangerous frontier where she’ll face awe-inspiring machines and mysterious new threats.

constellations_other.name: Scene-stealing giants
constellations_other.description: We Live in an Ocean of Air takes viewers inside the cycle of life through a giant sequoia (commonly known as a giant redwood). Find out how their ancient awesomeness has seen them loom over screen culture.

links.description: MLF undertook research and conducted tree scans in Sequoia National Park when developing We Live in an Ocean of Air. That exact location is recreated in Horizon: Forbidden West.

start.credit_line:
Marshmallow Laser Feast

In collaboration with Natan Sinigaglia & James Bulley

We Live in an Ocean of Air is a multi-sensory immersive installation that illuminates the invisible- but fundamental- connection that ties animal and plant, human and natural world, into a wondrous rhythm which underpins life on Earth.

constellations_primary.name: Scene-stealing giants
constellations_primary.description: We Live in an Ocean of Air takes viewers inside the cycle of life through a giant sequoia (commonly known as a giant redwood). Find out how their ancient awesomeness has seen them loom over screen culture.

end.title: Sanctuary of the Unseen Forest
end.credit_line: Marshmallow Laser Feast in collaboration with Andres Roberts and James Bulley
end.brief_description: Sanctuary of the Unseen Forest is a large-scale video installation that creates a moment of awe, felt when we embrace the presence of a majestic being, a giant Ceiba Pentandra from the Colombian Amazon.

constellations_primary.name: The forest for the trees
constellations_primary.description: Marshmallow Laser Feast's Sanctuary of the Unseen Forest celebrates the majestic Colombian kapok tree. Let's look back at some of screen culture's other mighty trees and forests.

constellations_other.name: Scene-stealing giants
constellations_other.description: We Live in an Ocean of Air takes viewers inside the cycle of life through a giant sequoia (commonly known as a giant redwood). Find out how their ancient awesomeness has seen them loom over screen culture.

links.description: Both We Live in an Ocean of Air and Sanctuary of the Unseen Forest use computer-generated renderings of trees to explore the cycle of life. MLF explored and scanned trees in California and Colombia respectively.

start.title: Sanctuary of the Unseen Forest
start.credit_line: Marshmallow Laser Feast in collaboration with Andres Roberts and James Bulley
start.brief_description: Sanctuary of the Unseen Forest is a large-scale video installation that creates a moment of awe, felt when we embrace the presence of a majestic being, a giant Ceiba Pentandra from the Colombian Amazon.

constellations_primary.name: The forest for the trees
constellations_primary.description: Marshmallow Laser Feast's Sanctuary of the Unseen Forest celebrates the majestic Colombian kapok tree. Let's look back at some of screen culture's other mighty trees and forests.

constellations_other.name: Scene-stealing giants
constellations_other.description: We Live in an Ocean of Air takes viewers inside the cycle of life through a giant sequoia (commonly known as a giant redwood). Find out how their ancient awesomeness has seen them loom over screen culture.

end.title: The Last of Us
end.brief_description: A third person shooter/stealth/survival hybrid, in which twenty years after the outbreak of a parasitic fungus which takes over the neural functions of humans, Joel, a Texan with a tragic familial past, finds himself responsible with smuggling a fourteen year old girl named Ellie to a militia group called the Fireflies, while avoiding strict and deadly authorities, infected fungal hosts and other violent survivors.

constellations_other.name: Scene-stealing giants
constellations_other.description: We Live in an Ocean of Air takes viewers inside the cycle of life through a giant sequoia (commonly known as a giant redwood). Find out how their ancient awesomeness has seen them loom over screen culture.

constellations_other.name: Representation of women in videogames
constellations_other.description: Ms Pac-Man is the first famous female game protagonist, but let's face it – she's just Pac-Man with a bow. This Constellation looks at the history of female representation in videogames.

constellations_other.name: Gender avengers
constellations_other.description: Thelma and Louise and Promising Young Woman both celebrate women taking revenge on men who sexually assault them, although victory is temporary as the characters perish because of their choices.

links.description: Sanctuary of the Unseen Forest reveals the mycelium entangled with the roots of the kapok tree. These fungal threads can communicate and spread through a forest miles from its origin. The apocalyptic fungal virus in The Last of Us is spread through this network.

start.title: The Lost World: Jurassic Park
start.creator_credit: Steven Spielberg, Michael Kahn, Colin Wilson, Gerald R. Molen, Amblin Entertainment, Digital Image Associates, Universal Pictures, Rick Carter and David Koepp
start.brief_description: Four years after Jurassic Park’s genetically bred dinosaurs ran amok, multimillionaire John Hammond shocks chaos theorist Ian Malcolm by revealing that he has been breeding more beasties at a secret location.

constellations_other.name: Scene-stealing giants
constellations_other.description: We Live in an Ocean of Air takes viewers inside the cycle of life through a giant sequoia (commonly known as a giant redwood). Find out how their ancient awesomeness has seen them loom over screen culture.

end.title: Ark: Survival Evolved - Explorer's Edition
end.brief_description: Combining the base game with 3 massive Expansion Packs, ARK: Survival Evolved Explorer’s Edition is a ultimate way to get even more dinosaur action! The Explorer’s Edition gives you access to the mega hit ARK: Survival Evolved as well as the Scorched Earth, Aberration, and Extinction Expansion Packs, adding nearly 900 hours of gameplay!

constellations_other.name: Scene-stealing giants
constellations_other.description: We Live in an Ocean of Air takes viewers inside the cycle of life through a giant sequoia (commonly known as a giant redwood). Find out how their ancient awesomeness has seen them loom over screen culture.

links.description: Like The Lost World, in Ark: Survival Evolved the heroes must battle dinosaurs after being stranded on a mysterious island. One of the maps is set in a redwood forest, which players often take in-game screen grabs of.

start.title: Return of the Jedi
start.creator_credit: Richard Marquand, Howard Kazanjian and Lucasfilm, Ltd.
start.brief_description: The conclusion of the “Star Wars” trilogy begins with the rescue of Hans Solo from the evil clutches of Jabba the Hutt. The Galactic Empire has resurrected the Death Star and plans to eliminate the Rebel Alliance once and for all. Luke Skywalker, grappling with the secret that Darth Vader is his father, who was turned evil by the Dark Side of the Force, must confront the Emperor in one final battle. From the seedy den of Jabba the Hutt, to the luscious green peacefulness of the planet Endor with its Ewoks, “The Return of the Jedi” is an entralling action-packed special effects adventure.

end.title: Rise of the Planet of the Apes
end.creator_credit: Amanda Silver, Dylan Clark, Peter Chernin and Rick Jaffa

video_links.name: Rise of the Planet of the Apes | Official Trailer HD | 2011
Rise of the Planet of the Apes | Trailer | 20th Century FOX
Rise of the Planet of the Apes | Official  International Trailer | 2011
Rise of the Planet of the Apes | Official Trailer #2 | 2011

end.brief_description: A highly intelligent chimpanzee named Caeser has been living a peaceful suburban life ever since he was born. But when he gets taken to a cruel primate facility, Caeser decides to revolt against those who have harmed him.

constellations_other.name: Scene-stealing giants
constellations_other.description: We Live in an Ocean of Air takes viewers inside the cycle of life through a giant sequoia (commonly known as a giant redwood). Find out how their ancient awesomeness has seen them loom over screen culture.

links.description: While Ewoks are native to the redwood villages of Endor, Rise of the Planet of the Apes‘ Caesar and his primate army make a redwood forest their habitat after gaining super intelligence and taking over the planet.

start.title: We Live in an Ocean of Air
start.credit_line:
Marshmallow Laser Feast

In collaboration with Natan Sinigaglia & James Bulley
start.brief_description:
We Live in an Ocean of Air is a multi-sensory immersive installation that illuminates the invisible- but fundamental- connection that ties animal and plant, human and natural world, into a wondrous rhythm which underpins life on Earth.

Existing in the liminal space between art, science and technology, it blurs the boundaries of installation, live performance and virtual reality and enchants the everyday world by revealing the natural forces that exist around us. Vitally, it provides an alternative platform to view the challenges our planet faces in the twenty-first century and helps us to reflect on our dependence and responsibility to the organisms we share it with.

From the food we eat, the water we drink and the air we breathe, humanity’s dependence on the natural world is absolute. Marshmallow Laser Feast confront these issues head on through a magical and moving experience - and invite you to join them on it.

constellations_primary.description: We Live in an Ocean of Air takes viewers inside the cycle of life through a giant sequoia (commonly known as a giant redwood). Find out how their ancient awesomeness has seen them loom over screen culture.

end.title: Return of the Jedi
end.creator_credit: Richard Marquand, Howard Kazanjian and Lucasfilm, Ltd.
end.brief_description: The conclusion of the “Star Wars” trilogy begins with the rescue of Hans Solo from the evil clutches of Jabba the Hutt. The Galactic Empire has resurrected the Death Star and plans to eliminate the Rebel Alliance once and for all. Luke Skywalker, grappling with the secret that Darth Vader is his father, who was turned evil by the Dark Side of the Force, must confront the Emperor in one final battle. constellations_other.name: Scene-stealing giants
constellations_other.description: We Live in an Ocean of Air takes viewers inside the cycle of life through a giant sequoia (commonly known as a giant redwood). Find out how their ancient awesomeness has seen them loom over screen culture.

links.description: In We Live in an Ocean of Air the giant sequoia reveals the interconnectedness of life, but in Return of the Jedi they represent the forest moon of Endor, where the Ewoks live in redwood treehouses and the rebels launch their attack.
